actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 93-217.
Measure passed Senate, amended, roll call #238 (71-25).
Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to designate the Tuesday next after the first Monday in October as the day for Federal elections.

summary.text: (LATEST SUMMARY) Requires any political party which nominates its candidate for election to the office of President by national nominating convention, to hold that convention beginning on the third Monday in August of the year in which the President and Vice President are elected. Makes election day with respect to Federal offices a national holiday. States that Federal elections are to be held on the first Tuesday next after the first Monday in November in 1976 and every second year thereafter.

titles.title: A bill to designate the Tuesday next after the first Monday in October as the day for Federal elections.
